field.label: Enabled
field.comment: Enables or disables Facebook Pixel.

field.label: Facebook Pixel ID
field.comment: Your Facebook Pixel ID or comma-separated IDs. WARNING! See the tooltip!
field.tooltip:
You can use multiple pixels and they will track the same information. There is no limit on the number of IDs. However, Facebook does not recommend using multiple pixels on the same page.
"Using the track function on pages that have multiple pixels initialized (either using multiple base codes or even combining it within one base code) could produce over-firing or unexpected behavior and should be applied only in specific situations."

field.label: Add Facebook Pixel To
field.comment: Type page handles (full action names) where you want Facebook Pixel.
field.tooltip:
The page handles - Synonyms of the page type identifiers. Correspond to "full action names" of controller actions, for example, catalog_product_view
In this option you would type all handles where you want Facebook Pixel to appear.

field.label: Enable Facebook Pixel Base Code

field.label: Enable noscript Tag

field.tooltip: This option enables noscript tag. The noscript tag defines an alternate content to be displayed to users that have disabled scripts in their browser or have a browser that does not support scripts. There is no need for noscript tag because Magento requires scripts to function.

If the contents have only one element this option will try to move disallowed parameters outside contents. If the contents have more than one element then disallowed parameters will be removed from the contents.

field.label: Detect Selected SKU
field.comment: Try to detect selected SKU for downloadable, simple, virtual, etc. WARNING! See the tooltip!
field.tooltip: This feature is heavily dependent on the theme you are using and its customization. It is impossible to predict all possible themes and customizations. Because of this detection will not work on every theme. This is why extension default configuration comes with this feature turned off. You can turn it on, try it out if it is working for you and if it does leave it on, otherwise turn it off. If you are a developer you will be pleased to know that everything is conveniently located in code.phtml file. To make it work, in some cases only the adjustment of few jQuery selectors is needed in others complete rewrite of detection code is needed. Because of this, we do not give any warranty for the detection feature, nor it is covered by our support service.

field.label: Enable Facebook Conversions API
field.comment: Enables or disables Facebook Conversions API. WARNING! See the tooltip!
field.tooltip: Facebook Conversions API will not work without valid Access Token and API Version.

field.label: Facebook Access Token
field.comment: Your Facebook Access Token. WARNING! See the tooltip!
field.tooltip: Facebook Conversions API will not work without a valid Access Token.

field.label: Facebook API Version
field.comment: Your Facebook API Version. WARNING! See the tooltip!
field.tooltip: Facebook Conversions API will not work without a valid API Version.

field.label: Test Event Code
field.comment: Your test_event_code for testing events. WARNING! See the tooltip!
field.tooltip: WARNING! Leave this field empty! Only use it for testing purposes. Facebook Conversions API allows you to test your events. Be aware Facebook gives priority to Facebook Pixel (client-side) events. If both Facebook Pixel (client-side) and Facebook Conversions API (server-side) events are fired the latter will be disregarded (dropped). The test_event_code is useful if your Magento store is in production and you want to test server-side events without turning off Facebook Pixel (client-side) events. You can see test events in your Facebook Business Manager.

field.label: Log Events
field.comment: Enable logging of events. WARNING! See the tooltip.
field.tooltip: WARNING! Leave this option disabled! Only enable it for debugging purposes.

field.label: Event Firing Mode
field.comment: Select event firing mode. WARNING! See the tooltip.
field.tooltip:
Mode 1
Events fire via AJAX calls. In this mode, you can fire both the Facebook Pixel event and Facebook Conversions API event simultaneously.
Mode 2 (API Only)
Events fire from the server without going to the web browser. In this mode, you cannot send both Facebook Pixel and Facebook Conversions API events simultaneously. If a particular Facebook Conversions API event is enabled, the corresponding Facebook Pixel event is automatically disabled to avoid duplication.

field.comment: Type event name you want to use for category tracking. See the tooltip.
field.tooltip: The proper event should be ViewCategory but Facebook specification does not have this (yet) as standard event. You can use ViewContent. Leave this option to empty if you want only PageView event on category pages. Recommendation is to set this option to empty or use ViewCategory as custom event.

field.label: Category Parameters to Attributes Mapping
field.comment: If you want to add custom parameters to categories. Please see the tooltip.
field.tooltip:
Example: gpc=gpc|color=color
As you can see the format is simple
param1=attribute1|param2=attribute2
Facebook Pixel parameter and Magento category attribute are connected by = sign and pairs are separated by | sign.
